document.discussion_title: Teenager stabbed at state fair - Story | OurQuadCities
document.topic_text: Teenager stabbed at state fair By Ashley Richmond | Published 08/21 2016 09:41PM Updated 08/21 2016 09:41PM Copyright 2016 Nexstar Broadcasting, Inc. All rights reserved. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten, or redistributed. State Police say a stabbing incident sent a teenager to the hospital on Saturday night. Officers say there was an incident involving several minors inside the Carnival on the fairgrounds. They say a 16-year-old female was stabbed. She's expected to be released from the hospital today. Police arrested a 17-year-old female for the incident. No word on charges. Police say this was an isolated incident. The Sangamon County Sheriff's Office, the Springfield Police Department and Conservation Police are all patrolling the fair. ISP is asking anyone who notices criminal activity to report it to law enforcement. Copyright 2016 Nexstar Broadcasting, Inc. All rights reserved. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten, or redistributed.
